@graph.name: Easy Homemade Pizza Dough - JoyFoodSunshine
@graph.description: This Easy Homemade Pizza Dough recipe is made with 5 ingredients in 30 minutes and does not need time to rise. Makes the ebst homemade pizza!

@graph.name: Can I freeze this pizza dough?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Yes, there are three ways to freeze this dough:
1. Form it into a ball, wrap in plastic wrap and freeze in an airtight container or plastic bag.
2. Pre-bake the crust for 5 minutes without toppings. Let it cool, wrap it tightly with plastic wrap and foil and freeze. To use, let it thaw, add toppings and bake according to the recipe.
3. Freeze a fully assembled pizza before baking. You can make your own frozen pizzas by making this pizza dough, topping it with sauce and toppings and flash-freezing it on a baking sheet. One it's hardened, wrap it tightly in plastic wrap and foil and freeze for up to 2 months. Let thaw and bake.

@graph.name: Can I let the dough rise?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, for a thicker, fluffier dough let it rise for 15-30 minutes, or until doubled.

@graph.name: Can I make this dough the night before?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, to make this dough the night before put it in a bowl, cover it tightly with plastic wrap and a damp towel and store it in the refrigerator.

@graph.name: Easy Homemade Pizza Dough
@graph.description: This Easy Homemade Pizza Dough recipe yields the best ever homemade pizza in 30 minutes from start to finish! It’s made with only 5 ingredients and does not require any rising! Plus it is vegan with a gluten-free option.

video.name: Easy Homemade Pizza Dough Recipe
video.description: This Easy Homemade Pizza Dough recipe yields the best ever homemade pizza in 30 minutes from start to finish! It’s made with only 5 ingredients and does not require any rising! Plus it is vegan with a gluten-free option.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Grease a pizza pan or large jelly roll pan and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Grease a pizza pan or large jelly roll pan and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Put warm water into a large mixing bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Put warm water into a large mixing bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Add sugar and yeast and stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add sugar and yeast and stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Let mixture sit for 5 minutes, or until it becomes frothy and bubbles form.
recipeInstructions.name: Let mixture sit for 5 minutes, or until it becomes frothy and bubbles form.

recipeInstructions.text: Add olive oil and gently stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add olive oil and gently stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 2 cups of flour and salt and mix with a spatula until a ball begins to form (dough will still be slightly sticky). Add more flour as needed to form a dough ball.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 2 cups of flour and salt and mix with a spatula until a ball begins to form (dough will still be slightly sticky). Add more flour as needed to form a dough ball.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer to a floured surface and knead into a smooth dough, adding up to ½ cup extra flour if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer to a floured surface and knead into a smooth dough, adding up to ½ cup extra flour if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Roll dough into your desired shape and gently transfer to your prepared pan. (Or bake on a pizza stone, see instructions in the notes).
recipeInstructions.name: Roll dough into your desired shape and gently transfer to your prepared pan. (Or bake on a pizza stone, see instructions in the notes).

recipeInstructions.text: To ensure the dough doesn't form air pockets, use a fork to prick to the dough all around (gently so you do not poke holes all the way through the crust).
recipeInstructions.name: To ensure the dough doesn't form air pockets, use a fork to prick to the dough all around (gently so you do not poke holes all the way through the crust).

recipeInstructions.text: Bake on the lower rack of your preheated oven for 5 minutes and remove from your oven. (this is just to very slightly prebake the dough). If you notice air bubbles forming, poke them with a fork to let the air out.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake on the lower rack of your preheated oven for 5 minutes and remove from your oven. (this is just to very slightly prebake the dough). If you notice air bubbles forming, poke them with a fork to let the air out.

recipeInstructions.text: Add pizza sauce and toppings of choice!
recipeInstructions.name: Add pizza sauce and toppings of choice!

recipeInstructions.text: Bake on the lower rack of your oven for around 15-20 minutes until the crust looks crispy and lightly browned.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake on the lower rack of your oven for around 15-20 minutes until the crust looks crispy and lightly browned.
